column1: Bogorodsk (Russian: Богоро́дск) is a town and the administrative center of Bogorodsky District in Nizhny Novgorod Oblast
column3: located 43 kilometers (27 mi) southwest of Nizhny Novgorod
column4: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 35

column1: It has been known since 1570 as the village of Bogorodichnoye
column3: or Bogorodskoye. It was granted town status in 1923.

column3: it is incorporated within Bogorodsky District as the town of district significance of Bogorodsk. As a municipal division
column4: the town of district significance of Bogorodsk is incorporated within Bogorodsky Municipal District as Bogorodsk Urban Settlement.

column1: Bogorodsk is one of the oldest centers of the leather industry in Russia.
The NRING Circuit is located in Bogorodsk
column2: and is used for Russian national motor racing events.
